node.title: Woman, 70, from Binjari becomes first Northern Territory death from coronavirus
node.alt: An aerial view of the community of Binjari, in the Northern Territory.
node.description: NT Chief Minister Michael Gunner says the woman battled COVID symptoms in hospital for a fortnight before her condition deteriorated rapidly in hospital yesterday.
node.content:
["The Northern Territory has recorded its first death from COVID-19.", "The person was a woman in her 70s from the Binjari community, just outside of Katherine.", "Her\u00a0infection was linked to the current coronavirus cluster in the Katherine region.", "Before now, the Northern Territory was the only jurisdiction in Australia without any deaths from coronavirus.", "In a statement announcing her death, the NT government said the woman was not vaccinated.", "\"The NT Government extends its sincere condolences to her family and loved ones,\" the statement read.", "The number of positive cases connected to\u00a0the Katherine region outbreak currently stands at 60.", "As of yesterday morning, two people who were part of the cluster were in hospital.", "NT Health Minister Natasha Fyles yesterday said\u00a0those two people were receiving \"acute-level care\" at Royal Darwin Hospital\u00a0and were receiving oxygen.", "However, she said neither of them were in the ICU.", "In a Facebook post, NT\u00a0Chief Minister Michael Gunner said he had been told the woman died in Royal Darwin Hospital overnight from complications related to COVID-19.", "\"I extend my deepest condolences to the family, friends and everyone in Binjari at this very difficult time,\" he wrote.", "\"This will be hard news to hear and I know this is a tight, loving community who care for each other.\"", "Hard lockdown restrictions were lifted in Binjari yesterday, after several days with no new COVID cases.", "The community 15 kilometres outside Katherine was placed under a hard lockdown when nine cases were recorded there on November 21.", "More to come.\u00a0", "", "
Heavily mutated Omicron variant puts scientist on alert
"]
